document.docAuthor: Picciani, Natasha, Pires, Débora O. & Silva, Hélio R.
document.masterDocTitle: Cnidocysts of Caryophylliidae and Dendrophylliidae (Cnidaria: Scleractinia): Taxonomic Distribution and Phylogenetic Implications

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Cnidocysts of Caryophylliidae and Dendrophylliidae (Cnidaria: Scleractinia): Taxonomic Distribution and Phylogenetic Implications

subSubSection.paragraph: (tab. 4 ; fig. 5 )

Remarks. B-rhabdoids ( 3 ) from tentacles are similar to those of the other dendrophylliids, but are smaller in size. Two size classes of p-rhabdoids D ( 2 ) could be distinguished in mesenterial filaments (fig. 5 H, I). Holotrichs II were absent from tentacles and mesenterial filaments.

FIGURE 3 .
Cnidom of
Dendrophyllia alternata
( MNRJ 6827 ). A. spirocyst; B. holotrich II; C. b-rhabdoid ( 1 ); D. b-rhabdoid ( 2 ); E. b-rhabdoid 1 ; F. p-rhabdoid D ( 1–2 ); G. p-rhabdoid D ( 2 ); H, I. holotrich I; J. b-rhabdoid ( 1 ); K. b-rhabdoid ( 2 ); L. brhabdoid 1 ; M, N, O . p-rhabdoid D ( 2 ). Tentacles: A–G. Mesenterial filaments: H– O . Scale bar= 10 μm.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4. Diversity of size and form of p-rhabdoids D (2) in mesenterial filaments of
Dendrophyllia alternata
(MNRJ 6827). Scale bar=10μm.

Dendrophyllia alternata
(MNRJ 6827, Paraná, Brasil).N = number of cap-

TABLE 4. Distribution and size of cnidocysts of
Enallopsammia rostrata
(MNRJ 6813, Paraná, Brasil).N = number of cap-

tr.th: Mean and range of length and width of capsules in Μm (± standard deviation)

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks. A variety of b-rhabdoid similar to b-rhabdoid ( 2 ) was observed in mesenterial filaments (b-rhabdoid 1 : fig. 6 L), presenting a tubule arranged in fewer coils, and a capsule more elongated and cylindrical. Opaque capsules occurred in the tentacles (fig. 6 G).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5. Cnidom of
Enallopsammia rostrata
(MNRJ 6813). A. spirocyst; B. holotrich I; C. b-rhabdoid (2); D. p-rhabdoid D (1–2); E. holotrich I; F. b-rhabdoid (1); G. b-rhabdoid (2); H. p-rhabdoid D (2); H’. discharged p-rhabdoid D (2); I. p-rhabdoid D (2). Tentacles: A–D. Mesenterial filaments: E–I. Scale bar=10μm.
